intro: Ormocarpum striolatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed capsule that splits open to release seeds. Ormocarpum striolatum is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
